definition: "Red Poppies", novel by 阿來|阿来[A1 lai2]
lit. the dust has settled (idiom)/fig. to get sorted out/to be finalized
dust/dirt/earth
abbr. for Egypt 埃及[Ai1 ji2]
dust/dirt/angstrom/phonetic ai or e
colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind
to set/to fix/to determine/to decide/to order

sentences.english: But the world has become a repeated dust, the dust has settled that moment, Jesus Christ reincarnation.
sentences.chinese: 不過成爲世間一屢塵埃，塵埃落定那刻，萬世輪迴。

sentences.english: It takes the edge off my hangover, kicks up the dust of last night’s drunk and gives it life.
sentences.chinese: 宿醉勾了起來，昨晚已經塵埃落定的醉意又煥發生機。

sentences.english: After a long time negotiations, the restructuring between GAIG and Changfeng Automobile is finally settled.
sentences.chinese: 曠日持久的廣汽與長豐汽車重組一事終於塵埃落定。

sentences.english: Your period of meditation, reflection, or investigation will soon begin to wind down.
sentences.chinese: 你現階段的考量，沉思或者是調查會開始塵埃落定。

sentences.english: He has promised that one day he will set everything right.
sentences.chinese: 他承諾我們，有一天，一切會塵埃落定。

sentences.english: The state of completion always creates a sense of achievement.
sentences.chinese: 塵埃落定總是會造就成就感。

sentences.english: Recently, the Legend interested in the real estate sector apprehensively finally settled.
sentences.chinese: 近日，有關聯想有意介入地產界的懸念終於塵埃落定。

sentences.english: A rainfall will settle the dust on the road.
sentences.chinese: 一場雨使馬路上的塵埃落定。

sentences.english: The court had made the final sentence of Xuting case, but reflecting upon this case just begin.
sentences.chinese: 許霆案已經塵埃落定，但對於該案的反思纔剛剛開始。

sentences.english: Definite End is the Tibetan minority writer Alai's first novel.
sentences.chinese: 《塵埃落定》是藏族作家阿來的第一部長篇小說。

definition: (of a check etc) to cash/to honor a commitment
to stop/to terminate (law)
to reopen
to leave a place where some event is taking place/(of an actor) to exit/(sports) to leave the field/(of an audience) to leave
prepared against war/to prepare for war/warmongering
to postpone
to trigger/to spark
to hold back one's troops without moving (idiom); to bide one's time
general election
to undulate/to fluctuate/wave motion/rise and fall
to take action/to adopt policies/to move on some issue
to worry/to be concerned
to reach agreement
to wait and see/to watch from the sidelines/to look around/to survey
schedule/timetable
to freeze (water etc)/(fig.) to freeze (assets, prices etc)
